Fantastically explained.

If i = sqrt(-1) then -1 = i * i = sqrt(-1) * sqrt(-1) = sqrt( (-1) * (-1) ) = sqrt(1) = 1. That's why I would rather assume i ^ 2 = -1, rather than i = sqrt(-1) because it doesn't lead to such contradictions.
